title: Five-Star Sri Lanka Wellness Retreat with Daily Breakfast, Four-Course Lunch or Dinner & Free-Flow Drinks Hour
description:
Immerse yourself in the serene beauty of Sri Lanka with a stay at this award-winning resort, nestled in the UNESCO World Heritage-listed Knuckles Mountain Range. Perched in the island's central highlands, this boutique retreat seamlessly blends wellness and luxury amidst breathtaking natural surroundings.

At the heart of this sanctuary is the Aarogya Luxury Spa, where personalised Balinese and Ayurvedic treatments await. Indulge in rejuvenation with access to an infrared sauna, yoga sessions and meditation, designed to help you achieve inner harmony. Unwind in the privacy of your villa, each offering unparalleled comfort with either a jacuzzi or plunge pool.

Explore the nearby city of Kandy, home to the sacred Temple of the Tooth and the stunning Royal Botanical Gardens. Return to the resort to enjoy a refreshing dip in the infinity pool before savouring exquisite Sri Lankan cuisine at The Verandah restaurant, accompanied by sweeping views of the surrounding mountains.
offer_address: 100 Malgamandeniya Road, Alawatugoda, Kandy 20140, Sri Lanka

title: Award-Winning Luxury in the Heart of Kandy with Room Upgrade & Daily Breakfast
description:
Experience unsurpassed opulence and old-world charm in the heart of Kandy at The Radh - an award-winning boutique retreat ideally located on the doorstep of the breathtaking Temple of the Sacred Tooth Relic. Crowned Luxury City Hotel winner at the 2020 Luxury Hotel Awards, this architectural gem glows with Sri Lankan aristocracy through its effortlessness blend of royal grandeur and contemporary minimalism. Featuring a first-class Japanese restaurant by renowned chef and restaurateur Dharshan Munidasa, and a luxurious spa practising Ayurvedic and Javanese treatments, The Radh specialises in refined sophistication.

Proudly located in the cultural hub of Kandy - also known as The Hill Capital - The Radh sits in close proximity to some of the city's most splendid landmarks, including scenic Kandy Lake, the glorious Old Royal Palace and World Buddhist Museum, all less than a 10-minute stroll away. The Temple of the Sacred Tooth is Sri Lanka's most important Buddhist relic and a must-see when in Kandy, drawing tourists and devoted worshippers year-round to its eye-catching golden roof and stunningly ornate interiors.
